page.title: 05The Trees of Arden
page.content: About one sixth of the area is covered with woods. Most of the trees are deciduous but there are some conifer plantations in the Crosskeys area and in Glen Fruin. The trees in these plantations are Sitka Spruce and Scots Pine. Many of the woods are a mixture of deciduous trees and conifers. The oak is the most common type of tree. The birch is second and the ash, beech and sycamore are third. There are also holly, willow, larch, hazel, fir, pine and horse chestnut. The spruce is used for christmas trees. Conifers are used for pulp. Stobs are made from any of the trees. The woods provide cover for the birds and are useful for wind breaks.
